newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Midcontinent Chicago unleaded gasoline firms.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Midcontinent Chicago unleaded gasoline firms.

text.p: U.S. Midcontinent spot unleaded gasoline prices firmed in Chicago on stronger differentials for late-August deliveries as trade wound down in the cash market on Monday, traders said.
In contrast, Group Three basis in Monday afternoon discussion eased as buyers were outnumbered by sellers motivated by strong prevailing prices in the market, traders said.
"We were slightly weaker, with more sellers than buyers, especially for diesel fuel" one trader active in the Group market said.

Gasoline prices were under pressure from lower prices on the NYMEX, where bids in ACCESS after-hours trade had eased to 60.75 cents a gallon after the contract closed at 61.62 cents in the earlier floor session.
Group Three unleaded gasoline was bid 2.25 cents a gallon over the print for prompt deliveries and 1.50 cents over for later deliveries, easing 0.25 cent a gallon.
Chicago unleaded firmed 0.50 cent a gallon to bids 2.75 cents under the print for late-August deliveries.

Group Three low sulphur diesel remained bid 3.50 cents a gallon over the print for prompt and later deliveries, and Chicago low sulphur diesel firmed 0.25 cent to bids 1.75 cents a gallon over the print.
High sulphur diesel was talked 1.25 cents over the print in Group Three and 0.50 cent over in Chicago, traders said.
